did.unittitle: Chemical Heritage Foundation staff files (John Van Ness)

bioghist.p: In 1982, the Center for the History of Chemistry (CHOC) was launched as a pilot project of the University of Pennsylvania and the American Chemical Society (ACS). In 1987 CHOC was incorporated as a not-for-profit organization, now named the National Foundation for the History of Chemistry, by joint action of the ACS and AIChE, the Center's third sponsor. In 1992 the Chemical Heritage Foundation (CHF) assumed its present name to better reflect the interdisciplinary nature of the sciences and industries it serves and the widening public scope of its activities. John Van Ness is CHF's Vice President for Administration.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the working files of John Van Ness. Materials include: records relating to awards, conferences, and special events; documents on CHF programs such as the oral history project; strategic planning, budget planning, and feasibility studies records; reports to the Board of Directors and the CHF Heritage Council; Development Committee minutes and agendas; corporate giving and major donor prospect reports; reference files on other institutions; museum planning documents; notes from weekly meetings with various staff members; and documentation of events planning, such as publicity materials, invitations, and attendance lists.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
